abstract: Regulators are looking whether a Barclays trader in Europe worked with counterparts at Crédit Agricole, HSBC, Deutsche Bank and Société Générale to manipulate interest rates.
snippet: Regulators are looking whether a Barclays trader in Europe worked with counterparts at Crédit Agricole, HSBC, Deutsche Bank and Société Générale to manipulate interest rates.
lead_paragraph: While much of the scrutiny surrounding interest rate manipulation has centered on Barclays, regulators have said that traders at the big British bank colluded with rivals to influence a key benchmark.

headline.main: Scrutiny Intensifies on Collusion in Rate Inquiry

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Federal Reserve Bank of New York

byline.original: By Azam Ahmed and Ben Protess
